name: Parasnath Temple
description: Ancient Jain temple on the tallest hill in Jharkhand.
longDescription: Parasnath Temple, located atop Parasnath Hill, is a sacred Jain pilgrimage site. Surrounded by dense forest, it offers trekking opportunities and panoramic views.
history: Parasnath is the highest peak in Jharkhand and has been an important Jain pilgrimage site for centuries.
culturalOverview: Thousands of Jain pilgrims visit during festivals and rituals. Local tribal communities also respect the hill as sacred.
importance: Religious tourism, trekking, and biodiversity hotspot.
thingsToCarry: Trekking gear, water, camera, comfortable shoes
speciality: Combination of Jain pilgrimage and trekking through forest.

name: Baidyanath Dham (Deoghar)
description: One of the 12 Jyotirlingas of Lord Shiva.
longDescription: Baidyanath Dham is a famous Shiva temple attracting millions of devotees annually. It is especially crowded during the Shravan month of the Hindu calendar.
history: Believed to be over 1000 years old and revered as a Jyotirlinga.
culturalOverview: Devotees perform rituals and offer prayers, especially during Shravan. Pilgrimage fairs are common.
importance: Major religious tourism site and cultural heritage of Jharkhand.
thingsToCarry: Water, modest clothing, camera, sun protection
speciality: Jyotirlinga temple with annual Shravan pilgrimage.

name: Chhoti Mandir, Ranchi
description: Famous temple dedicated to Lord Shiva in Ranchi city.
longDescription: Chhoti Mandir is located in the heart of Ranchi and attracts locals and tourists alike. It is known for its beautiful architecture and peaceful surroundings.
history: Built during the British era, serving as a local religious center.
culturalOverview: Local festivals like Maha Shivratri are celebrated with great enthusiasm.
importance: Urban religious site, cultural heritage, and community center.
speciality: City temple with serene ambiance and religious significance.

name: Jogindernath Temple, Ranchi
description: Ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva.
longDescription: Situated in Ranchi, this temple is famous for its spiritual atmosphere and regular rituals performed by devotees.
history: Several hundred years old and maintained by local trusts.
culturalOverview: Hosts religious gatherings during festivals like Shivratri.
importance: Spiritual site and cultural landmark in Ranchi.

name: Harihar Temple, Ranchi
description: Popular temple dedicated to Lord Shiva and Lord Vishnu.
longDescription: Harihar Temple is known for its beautiful architecture and peaceful environment. Many devotees visit daily for prayers and rituals.
history: Established decades ago and maintained by local community.
culturalOverview: Local festivals and weekly rituals attract large crowds.
importance: Religious tourism and local cultural hub.
speciality: Dual deity temple with serene ambiance.

name: Dhabasini Temple, Ranchi
longDescription: Located near Ranchi, this temple attracts devotees for its religious rituals and serene surroundings. Popular during Navratri.
history: Has been a local spiritual site for generations.
culturalOverview: Celebrations during Navratri are major attractions for devotees.
importance: Religious tourism and cultural heritage site.
speciality: Goddess temple with vibrant festival celebrations.

name: Sita Temple, Ranchi
description: Temple dedicated to Goddess Sita in Ranchi.
longDescription: Sita Temple is popular among locals and tourists, known for its peaceful environment and spiritual significance.
history: Built by local devotees and maintained over the years.
culturalOverview: Special prayers during Ram Navami are conducted here.
importance: Religious and cultural significance for locals.
speciality: Peaceful urban temple with festival significance.

name: Jamshedpur Shiva Temple
description: Famous Shiva temple in Jamshedpur city.
longDescription: Located in Jamshedpur, the temple attracts devotees for daily prayers and special rituals during festivals like Maha Shivratri.
history: Constructed in the 20th century, maintained by local devotees.
culturalOverview: Hosts cultural events and community gatherings during festivals.
importance: Urban religious site and cultural hub.
speciality: City temple with active community participation.

name: Rajrappa Temple
description: Ancient temple of Goddess Chhinnamastika near Ramgarh.
longDescription: Rajrappa Temple is a pilgrimage site known for its scenic location at the confluence of rivers and its religious significance.
history: Historic temple revered for centuries by locals and pilgrims.
culturalOverview: Attracts thousands of devotees during Chhinnamastika festival.
speciality: Riverside temple with unique architecture and festivals.

name: Sundarnath Shiva Temple, Deoghar
description: Popular Shiva temple in Deoghar district.
longDescription: Sundarnath Temple is visited by devotees for daily rituals and during Maha Shivratri. It is known for its beautiful surroundings.
history: Several decades old and maintained by local religious trust.
culturalOverview: Hosts major religious events during festivals.
importance: Religious tourism and local cultural significance.
